result.execSummary:
The defendant Javon Roosevelt Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable Court costs and surcharges.  Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Remaining balance to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision.  Any unpaid amount to convert to civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also  that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javon Roosevelt Carter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE), with credit for 234 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Any unpaid amount to convert to civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Javon Roosevelt Carter in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Megan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Javon Roosevelt Carter not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to the Court's congested calendar and lateness of the hour, Court is unable to conduct plea and sentencing date today. Matter is adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Javon Roosevelt Carter not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in trial and unable to conduct plea/sentencing today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
7.3015 court date is adjourned to 8.20.15.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Javon Roosevelt Carter not in court, in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Javon Roosevelt Carter not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 05-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Javon Roosevelt Carter in court, in custody with attorney Gregory A. Renden. David Behm on behalf of Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  James Henner, Detective - MPD.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 7.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.H., M.C., Mother's Food Store, 2879 N 16th Street.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Javon Roosevelt Carter in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Javon Roosevelt Carter in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
